abstract: Many are outraged by revelation that officials in Flint, Mich, were slow to act in Legionnaires' cases, which sickened at least 87 people in region, killing nine of them, from June 2014 through Oct 2015; review of government emails shows some at state level seemed more concerned about following bureaucratic protocol, and not raising public alarm over bacteria in water supply causing outbreak, than about protecting residents.

headline.print_headline: Flint Outbreak Was Treated With Silence
headline.main: Legionnaires’ Outbreak in Flint Was Met With Silence

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: An examination of government emails and interviews shows a failure to act swiftly to address a dangerous health problem or warn the public.
lead_paragraph: An examination of government emails and interviews shows a failure to act swiftly to address a dangerous health problem or warn the public.
